title: Efficient Practice
body: Practice uses the Patches system which is very efficient and helpful especially when working during the week. The system is particularly helpful in providing an overview of the topic, confirming availability for call backs and appointments. Practice was very responsive, appointment scheduled in 24 hours. Would highly recommend.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: The medical staff at this practice are always great but it has become increasingly difficult to get an appointment. I have used the e-consult in the past but now the practice no longer accepts e-consults. I have got the Airmid app but it is not possible to make appointments through this app. I can never get an appointment by phone so this means that it is not possible to get an appointment unless it is an absolute emergency. It is incredibly frustrating and it feels that a service is no longer being provided. It’s quite sad and it has made me want to switch practice.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Wenbs75
title: Car parking
body:
I am an NHST employee who had cause to attend an appointment at Ninewells Hospital this morning. Can the current parking arrangements please be reviewed. Having left home at 7:40am this morning to attend a 9:00am appt I felt I had left plenty of time. However, on arriving at Ninewells at approx 8:20 am there were no parking spaces available and I spent time circling around various car parks before finally giving up and rescheduling my appointment as I was not going to make it on time.  
Late cancellation of my appointment is the last thing I wanted to do but trying to park at the site at this time is really stressful. I appreciate there are no current parking charges which in my view is encouraging more people to travel to work via private vehicle but this is not great from a patient experience perspective and surely must be costing the organisation financially with either short notice cancellations or patients not attending appointments. I am able-bodied and could potentially walk some distance to allow me to access the hospital but this may not be the case for less abled service users. Just to note that I live rurally and required a private vehicle for onward travel to my place of employment.

author: ttt22
title: Left the early pregnancy clinic feeling bewildered
body:
Arrived at the early pregnancy clinic with my partner, tried to internal scan but my bladder was full, asked me to empty the bladder and keep a sample.  
The toilet left something to be desired, the bin was overflowing with urine dishes and felt very unsanitary.  
They tested the sample and it was now negative so they advised they weren't going to scan me again. They said it was an early pregnancy loss and asked if we had any questions but having no experience in this how would we know what to ask, etc. So we left bewildered.  
In hindsight and speaking to friends who had early losses but had been dealing with 2 different hospitals, there should have been explanation of what we could expect to happen over the next couple weeks or a scan to confirm everything had already came out. Not even a leaflet was handed over for advice or support.  
It felt very cold and not very reassuring especially for my first pregnancy and first (hopefully last) pregnancy loss.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: jupiterhq53
title: Excellent support during my pregnancy and labour
body:
I received excellent support throughout my pregnancy from my community midwife and amazing care during my labour.  
In particular Vanessa (my community midwife) was fantastic and I felt at ease when she was on shift for the majority of my labour. Vanessa was very supportive throughout labour and helped make me as comfortable as possible. Vanessa kept me informed throughout the labour of what was happening which helped to reassure me.  
Gillian (community midwife) was also very supportive and helpful during my pregnancy and home visit after my baby girl was born.  
All staff involved in my labour at Forth Valley Royal Hospital were amazing, I couldn’t fault any of them. In particular midwives Mary and Heather and consultant Kelly who helped deliver my baby girl.

author: butebird
title: Lack of suitable meal options
body:
My husband has spent the last 6 weeks in Inverclyde Royal Hospital. He is 66 years old and has Asperger's so it has been a very traumatic & stressful time for him.  
He is a vegetarian and also has food intolerances which he constantly had to remind them of. They gave him meat & fish based meals on a regular basis (being told that some vegetarians eat fish) and also meals that contained onions which is one of the items he has an intolerance to. He was either given a slice of toast as a replacement or frequently went without altogether.  
He was also given a sausage casserole one day; a corned beef sandwich, fish and chips. When he refused unsuitable food he was told he was too fussy and should stop moaning. He managed to speak to someone from the catering department who apologised but nothing changed and he continued to receive unsuitable meals.  
He also has problems cutting up his food but got no help so was surviving on soft food which he could eat with a spoon. I was unable to visit him to take him any food due to my own ill health. I am disgusted that he was being treated in this way and very upset. His mental health was suffering due to being in hospital for over 6 weeks but made even worse by not getting decent meals.  
They also managed to lose his clothes - a pair of trousers, a vest and a top. The staff blamed him for losing the items!  
All in all, a very stressful time for both of us especially as he has now been given a diagnosis of Parkinson's.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: tkf123
title: Bed in middle of bay
body:
I work for the NHS so fully understand the pressures we are facing. However my Dad was recently in AMU with no official bed space. He was in the middle of the bay in what is being referred to as a Boarders bed. He was admitted on a Wednesday and was in this bed space for 2 days. He is not going anywhere as is awaiting an Angiogram.  
Besides the issue he had no privacy or dignity, he was also blocking a fire door. How is this safe?  
The staff are amazing and clearly working under massive pressure. None of them seem to think it is a good idea but I have spoken to them and they are unable to move him when a normal bed becomes available ( which many have) as he is the most stable patient in the bay. I appreciate this but what happens if he does have a heart attack? There are no oxygen or suction points, and no call bell.  
He wanted to change his pyjama bottoms having been in hospital for 3 days and had to stand in the middle of the bay in his underpants. I attempted to close the patient nearest hims curtains to give him some kind of dignity but the patient was not very happy. I explained my Dad has no curtains of his own. My Dad is fully competent and has full capacity -but is breathless and experiencing chest pain whenever he moves so needs some of his own space and privacy.  
He witnessed another patient having a cardiac arrest on his first night and was able to tell me every detail - how is patient confidentiality being maintained when one bed is within centimetres of another.  
Privacy, dignity, confidentiality are these not our code of conduct. Please tell me how this has been allowed to happen.  
I re-iterate all the staff have been wonderful and so kind to Dad but they shouldn't be working in these conditions either. I am so disappointed and upset for my dad.

author: ttt22
title: 5 star service
body:
After a very long wait I got my appointment for the dermatology. The wait is understandable as people with skin cancer etc, I understand would gain priority. However due to the wait I had to go back onto hormonal contraception to clear my skin for a special upcoming event. I haven't been off the contraception long enough for my skin to flare up but I took the appointment as I didn't want to lose my place.  
So I met a lovely very understanding and reassuring lady called Anita. I showed her my photos and she looked at my skin now (but it's ok). However, based on the photos she has gave me an open ended review return to last the year and assured me what I'm doing now is all in order. Hopefully I won't need it but its reassuring to know I don't have to go through the long and distressing wait I had to the previous occasion. It was refreshing to be dealt with such compassion and empathy. Anita gets 5 stars from me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: waternb58
title: Communication failure
body:
I have tried to ring RMS number stated on your letter fails to ring out, I tried several times. My doctor refers me back to yourselves and won’t answer queries.  
Phone consultation has been arranged again, I already spent time explaining it doesn’t work for me due to my autistic processing, I miss 80% of the conversation and am constantly playing catch up. It would be far better to bear the lighting (upsets my nervous system) and come in if I were allowed to voice record and had questions put to me in advance to allow thinking time.  
I take at least 3 x as long as neurotypicals to think things through. It appears you don’t take what I say about my neuro-difference at all seriously but communication fails if in modes I cant use.  
The haematologist I spoke to Friday (I don't have a name as it was a phone call and I could not take notes and listen) said I would have bloods taken asap as I’ve started chemotherapy( hydroxycarbamide) on Friday as advised but I have had no date or venue for the test.  
When I called today the haematology secretary said an appointment had been made on 8/3 but gave no time or venue. As she predicted an appointment arrived by post but not for bloods, for a phone consult which is not what haematologist on duty had said. See above re phone consults. not ideal at all. i’m concerned re bloods as I will need time off work and to arrange staff cover for me which takes notice. If its imminent I need to know when/where.  
I am also concerned re the side effects of the tablets. At present I have alternate pill days I cannot function on as I am too dizzy to do responsible work or to drive. I am exhausted, in bed by 6pm after a dose. The following day I am nauseous and weak, i missed 3 breakfasts so far when I usually eat and have my losartan and aspirin now I cannot. So aspirin is on an empty stomach. I cant think clearly, lose my balance and struggle to carry anything at work. less than ideal with a physical job.  
I did say i was chemically sensitive and my dna analysis says detoxing is difficult. In 2020 I was close to suicide over the effects of amlodipine which caused me pain and the amitriptyline given to counter that blanked my brain so I couldn’t think, not going there again! Other suggestions welcome or ways to ameliorate the damage would help please. I was told someone would call back but nothing so far (end of working day, promise made in morning). i am hoping my mobile was tried as I work on a broad site and house phone is little use unless i am in the office(minority of time).

author: Patient531
title: Kind and excellent care every step of the way
body:
I was recently admitted to the day surgery unit at Queen Margaret Hospital, Dunfermline for a knee arthroscopy under general anaesthetic.  
I couldn't be more grateful for the excellent standard of care I received every step of the way, from my very first appointment at the orthopaedic surgery clinic to being discharged home after the arthroscopy.  
What an incredible team of professionals. I was treated with such kindness and the standard of care was excellent.  
A special thank you to Mr Akhtar, Simon, Neil, Carol, Paul, Dawn, Nicolle and Nola for the wonderful job they do. I am so grateful for all they did for me during my admission. My experience of the day surgery unit was so positive and I appreciated how well everything was explained to me every step of the way.  
I was discharged home with all the information, medications, dressings and physiotherapy exercises that I need. I know what the next steps in my treatment plan are and I'm pleased to say I am making an excellent recovery at home.

title: Devastating experience
body: Referred by GP several years back and since then I've gone from monthly panci attack to weekly panic attack to daily thanks to them. The crisis team do nothing if you have a crisis they simply say are you feeling sucidual if you say yes the will call an ambulance to take you to A& E if you say no but I need help it's end of conversation. I reached out to them numerous times and you have only one option given they can call an ambulance to go to A & E and if not you are to get off the line. I stopped even bothering to ring after I explained I needed to talk as panic attacks were getting worse to which they asked for my address I refused to give them it as I didn't want to go to A & E and I heard one say loudly to the other staff member "This person on phone wants help and won't even give her address and another member muttering or laughing either way it was extremely rude. I had counselling with them well a few and I'm not even going into that nightmare but I escaped from there and tried to contact a charity for actual help but by this time due to being traumatized by this place I was told I the charity couldn't help me as my score for both anxiety and depression was unbelievably high and wrote a letter to my GP recommending I be referred to the complex care team that's how bad this place left me but then I started avoiding GP because I realized they will probably refer me back to this place as it's local. I called NHS and they put me through to them so I just said I'm fine and hung up another crisis team somewhere else I didn't realize was connected to them as different area and she was lovely so I finally after years of being absolutely traumatized by them did finally get to talk to one single person that was great and told me to explain to my GP what I'd told her so I don't get referred back to them. I'm now up at 1.43am and after another panic attack so worried that if my GP can't find somewhere else other than this place I will not get the help I've needed for years as I'd never deal with them again.

title: Not enough support
body: I've been with HH for nearly 2 years, struggling with complex depression, anxiety, ptsd, diagnosed BPD and Schizotyal PD. I feel hugely neglected at times of crisis, I was never given a care supervisor which I told many people to their shock. I think it's a poorly run system. For over a year I waited for CBT only to be told they don't offer it. After I asked about a possible ADHD and ASD diagnosis they simply discharged me as they say 'we can't diagnose these here' without any care plan or follow up. Since then i have heard of many people who were diagnosed there and are also in the process of such. Now I feel like I have no support and I'm in another crisis. I tried to call them to explain but I can't get through.

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

author: Arabella64
title: Sigmoidoscopy
body:
Good care from Shona, Mr Amin, Lynsey and Scott.  
This is an unpleasant procedure. Pain management could have been better.

author: Daddysgirl
title: Cheeky abrupt nurse
body:
My father is in a nursing home with dementia/Parkinson’s. He’s been unwell for the last week , with high infection levels, the gp has been in a few times and he has antibiotics.  
Today the hospital at home care nurses came in to do bloods and other tests, before hospital doctors were due in. One of the nurses was very abrupt with my dad as he couldn’t communicate when they were was asking him questions, then when I asked questions regarding blood tests and him being taking to hospital I found them very rude, cheeky and their facial expressions had a lot to be desired as if I had no right to ask any questions, especially when I mentioned him getting iv antibiotic. I felt they did not have a good manner for being in that profession and I really hope my dad doesn’t have to deal with them again.  
I was really upset when they left the room. My dad is only in the care home two weeks and suddenly took unwell, myself and sister have had enough upset with his illness and needing care without been spoken to in that manner.

author: Sulr
title: Impressed by quick and efficient care for my dad
body:
Went to A&E on a Monday with my dad. He was dizzy and didn't feel good. We were seen much quicker than I thought we would be (after reading all the news stories etc).  
We were triaged pretty quick. His blood pressure was very high. In fact, it was 236 / 144 which was one of the highest the nurse had seen.  
A doctor saw him, and he was then taken for a CT Scan. Then he was admitted to the hospital for one week (Acute Stroke unit 11). This was all done in a timely manner and I was actually impressed after all the news and Facebook posts which were good and bad.  
I wish more people would elaborate when they leave negative feedback its not helpful.  
Anyway, all good from us. He spent one week on the ward. He's now home. Great, hardworking staff both in A&E and Unit 11. Thank you!  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
  
[Very happy with 'Environment']

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: passepartout
title: I can't sing their praises highly enough. Thank you.
body:
My elderly mother was taken to hospital two weeks ago suffering from pneumonia. She was taken immediately into A&E upon arrival by ambulance. The A & E staff were absolutely amazing. They allowed me in to sit with my mum who was very confused and anxious.  
I previously posted about poor communication last year.  
Communication in the Ulster Hospital has been absolutely fantastic. The contrast is astonishing. I was contacted by A & E to tell me when they had found a bed for my mum in ward 3A and that they would be moving her that day. I got a phone call later from the ward to tell me that my mum had arrived and that they were getting her settled. I was given information about her current status and visiting at that point. Each time something was done with my mum, the hospital contacted us to let us know in advance.  
All of the staff on ward 3a were incredibly helpful and engaged. It was never too much trouble for them to check the records and give us an update, even when my mum was not under their particular care. If they said they were going to ring us, they did. It was such a relief and reassurance to us. Even my mum, who can be a bit tetchy at times, spoke highly of those who cared for her.  
I know how much pressure all staff are under in the NHS yet never were we made to feel that they were too busy and did not have time to deal with us. The same in A&E, despite the frantic pace in there. I can't sing their praises highly enough. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Nessiethefr3nchie
title: Great support with my Diabetes
body:
In November 2021 I went to an appointment at my GP because I was concerned after advice from a colleague that I might have Type 1 Diabetes. The nurse tested my blood sugar and ketones and she was instantly concerned and phoned the Diabetes centre in Kirkcaldy and they advised I should go straight there. That day I was seen by Jeanette and she asked if I had anyone with me, I said my partner was in the car he had driven me to the hospital. Jeanette kindly insisted I asked my partner to come in to the room with us for support because there was a lot of information I was about to be told! This meant a lot to myself and my partner and we really appreciate being allowed to do this.  
Jeanette was very caring and friendly as she talked us through everything we needed to know. Jeanette set me up with a Libre 2 on this first day of diagnosis which was such an amazing help to make things that little bit easier. She also gave me her mobile number and even when she was off work at the weekend, on those first few scary days she was at the other end of the phone for me and always happy to help with any questions and helping me with insulin dosing.  
In my first couple of weeks of diagnosis I also had a couple of appointments with Jill, a dietitian who was amazingly supportive and helpful too. Jill got me to count carbohydrates from day one so that she could work out my ratios and was very supportive in me continuing a completely normal diet, not restricting myself which was obviously a big worry when you first hear the diagnosis of diabetes! During all my appointments over the first few weeks, whether they were over the phone, over video or in person, both Jill and Jeanette made everything as easy as I could possibly imagine and I felt extremely supported and felt I was getting plenty of information.  
Whenever I've sent any emails they have always been answered quickly and I've always been satisfied with the help I've received when I've needed it. I recently reached out to Jeanette via email after having problems with my Libre sensors/App not working very well. Jeanette quickly signed me up to the next available date to get started on the Dexcom G6 instead. I had previously been discussing changing to Dexcom with other nurses Fiona and Jenny however I never heard anything further after trying to chase this up a few weeks prior. When I expressed an interest in moving onto an insulin pump, Jeanette was very supportive of this. She made sure I got an appointment quickly with a consultant who could then start the process onto to the next step.  
I soon after started omnipod dash and got great support from Fiona in the weeks after my training and setup. There has only ever been one appointment at the Diabetes centre where I left feeling slightly deflated, a few weeks after starting on Omnipod I was there for a follow up appointment with Jenny. I was feeling really positive about the appointment because I had been trying hard to keep my blood sugars in range and my libre data at this point was 90% in range over the last 2 weeks which I was really pleased with myself for, and Fiona had been very pleased with similar results at my previous appointment. Jenny didn't log in to my libre data that day, she downloaded my pump data and she expressed disappointment that according to my pump my blood sugar was around 70% in range. I tried to say that my libre time in range was much higher and that my libre captures all data whereas my pump only captures the data I enter, when doing corrections when my blood sugar is high, but the focus seemed to be on looking for places for improvement which I understand, and of course appreciate the help and encouragement however I was just a bit deflated to not receive praise for my decent efforts!  
On the whole, my experience with the Kirkcaldy Diabetes centre over the last year and a half has been very positive and I'm very grateful to have such a great team available to me whenever I need them.

author: ORB Admin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They have showed me that help is out there.
body: First I was nervous and very anxious but now I'm very glad I started here at Bucks One Recovery. Everyone here are very friendly and helpful. I feel much better about myself on my personal journey. They have showed me that help is out there.

author: kendody99
title: Staff really have gone above and beyond
body:
After a disastrous December I have become a regular visitor here.  
Managed to amputate a toe and fracture some vertebrae and the staff really have gone above and beyond with their level of care and advice.

author: Grandchild
title: Great care in the Emergency department
body:
My mother is in her seventies and was admitted to ED for a medical admission by her clinic’s nurse practitioner. On arrival it was obvious that the department was extremely busy. The main concern while waiting was that my mother, who had a temperature, was very cold while waiting in the waiting area. The reception team did provide a blanket when we asked for one.  
After a wait, she was called through and initially seen by a junior doctor who planned her care and her care was taken over by nurse Andrew, who provided the best care and understanding to a niggled and scared pensioner.  
My mother was later transferred to AMAU and the care she received was second to none.  
As a family we can not thank Andrew and the staff on AMAU at a particularly busy time in the NHS, keep up the great work, you are all a credit to Dr Gray’s hospital.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: michjo
title: Long wait in A&E
body:
Attended A&E from an urgent GP referral with acute chest pain and suspected pulmonary embolism . Told by three members of staff I was expected and added to the list with the medic team.  
ECG, triage and bloods all done in the first half an hour of presenting. All going great I thought, only 3 other patients waiting. Roll onto 6hrs later and still no further. I am currently sat in A&E after 11:00 pm having been here since 4:00pm with no sign of being seen.  
The NHS is struggling and I believe the big bosses are to blame. Triage should be done by a doctor, that would stop a lot of the minor cases slipping through and filling up lists. A&E trips were once filled with dread when thinking about the possible 3-4hr stretch. To go beyond with no signs to an end is disgraceful. Staff are overworked.

author: leopardyg56
title: Great care experience in the labour ward
body:
I wanted to take the time to write about the exceptional care that we experienced when having our first baby at Wishaw General Hospital (Scotland).  
We had our baby boy at the end of December 2022 & spent 5 days in Wishaw with a short stay in Neonatal for our newborn.  
Our midwife Lauren was unbelievable at her job, she was so compassionate, kind, knowledgeable & caring. Everything you would want from a midwife. We then dealt with two other midwives due to a shift swap, Zoe & Susan who were also amazing.  
The days following we met many of the maternity/neonatal staff at Wishaw & every single person even down to the cleaners who kept our room so fresh & clean were amazing. The care & love we received was beyond anything we could imagine. The staff at Wishaw general are heroes.

author: Steph3694
title: As a first time mum I really appreciated this level of personal care
body:
Good morning,  
I am emailing to express fantastic care that I received in Bassetlaw hospital back in February.  
I was a first time expectant mum and on arriving at the labour ward things started to happen very quickly. Throughout the whole process Ellie was absolutely fantastic. She reassured me when she could see that I was unsure what was happening or going to happen. My babies heart rate started to drop which required intervention by other members of the team who were also fantastic. Again during this time she was able to tell how scared I was and constantly reassured and explained what I would need to do. All of this meant that our beautiful baby girl was born safe and sound.  
After the initial labour she helped me bathe and made sure any questions were answered before moving us to the postnatal ward. She even came to see us as she was walking through the next day.  
As a first time mum I really appreciated this level of personal care and felt nothing was too much trouble.  
Please could this be passed on to Ellie for me please.  
Thank you

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb Service
body: After just receiving goods results from my second PSA test. Concerned about suffering severe UTI and being in pain and uncomfortable. By 2.00 pm the same day. Appointment booked, sample in, gp consultation and prescription by 2.00pm. Nothing is too much for the close team at Shipdham. Thank you so much.

author: Pat48
title: Care & Support Received
body:
I had a colonoscopy recently and was obviously nervous about the procedure. All of the staff I met introduced themselves by name and went out of their way to comfort and reassure me. During the procedure they were caring and sensitive to any discomfort and did their best to keep this to an absolute minimum. It would be unfair to single out any one of them for particular praise as they all deserve my special thanks.  
It is often said and well deservedly, these amazing dedicated professionals are angels. They deserve our utmost respect and should be rewarded accordingly.

author: ORB South Admin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Felt like part of the group/team
body:
The health and care services were very helpful. The meetings with my Keyworker were very informative and helpful.  
The Inspire groups were interesting and I learnt a lot of useful pointers, which I have used in my day to day life.  
Things that would make it better would only be the fixing/buying of a new kettle.  
Felt like part of the group/team. It was very friendly and welcoming

author: ChristineMc
title: Gold standard care
body:
I am so impressed & incredibly grateful for the care & attention received by my aunt at this worrying time. From initial GP appointment when referral was made, things have progressed steadily forward with another step along the way each week. First an ultrasound, then a consultants appointment, carried out at the local community hospital in Ards. Close to home & very accessible. And treated with the utmost care & respect.  
Next a CT scan at the Downe. So swift and efficient yet carried out in a professional, caring & unhurried manner. Next a double endoscopy. This appointment was brought forward and arranged by telephone by Nathan. My aunt had been praying that she would get an answer about her diagnosis & a plan. When the call from Nathan came she was so incredibly grateful & relieved to get an appointment in just 2 days time. Nathan went by far above & beyond to ensure that she received the medication she needed prior to the procedure & dropped it off with her on his way home. Outstanding.  
On the morning of the appointment we were greeted at the Endoscopy Day Procedure Unit in the Ulster Hospital by a very friendly, cheerful and professional member of the team on the front desk. We were directed to the spacious & comfortable waiting area. Busy, with lots of patients, but not cramped or crowded. After a short wait the loveliest nurse, Pat, brought my aunt through to be admitted. Her manner & tone were perfect.  
The procedures involved were to be unpleasant but everything was clearly explained & described in a comprehensive, bright & user friendly way. Very important when someone is feeling anxious. My aunt was put at ease & was managed warmly & caringly and I felt 100% confident (& incredibly appreciative) that the staff were so professional & empathic.  
Whilst waiting for the procedures to be completed, other patients kept coming. All were greeted with the same warm & friendly attitude and brought through by nursing staff who were so relentlessly bright, warm & attentive. The level of care received at the outset of a daunting appointment & when being escorted back out to family members anxiously waiting to bring patients home couldn’t be more highly commended. Gold standard!! Outstanding. Thank you isn’t quite enough, but thank you all the same.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ms Mc 140
title: Our experience was excellent throughout our stay
body: My husband needed to attend for assessment due to his cardiac condition and was assessed and treated promptly by the amazing medical and nursing team on site. Despite obvious pressures and a very busy department, our experience was excellent throughout our stay

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: A.B Sess
title: Overwhelmed by the kindness, and professionalism
body:
I attended recently, to have a minor procedure done, and I cannot praise the entire staff of the section,highly enough.  
From the moment I arrived at 8am, till I was discharged at around 3pm,I was made feel very comfortable,and was overwhelmed by the kindness, and professionalism of all who I came into contact with during my stay.

author: bird967
title: Antenatal complementary therapy
body:
I am currently over 41 weeks pregnant and my community midwife (Lauren) informed me of an acupressure and aromatherapy service being piloted at Aberdeen Maternity Hospital. I made contact with them and had an appointment the next day with Geraldine. After checking me and my baby, she gave me acupressure to 3 sites and showed me how to do them myself at home, and she also gave me a very relaxing back, neck and shoulder massage using bespoke aromatherapy oils.  
I have been finding it difficult to relax and unwind recently and this has helped me a lot. Geraldine was very knowledgeable, and she also gave me a booklet of some other tips to try in preparation for labour which have been very helpful. I hope this service is expanded so that more women can access it. Thank you very much!

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: ORB South Admin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Found out more about myself and addiction
body:
Inspire Group and Relapse Prevention  
Found out more about myself and addiction Non-JudgementalInformative - Learnt new thingsGood to share personal experiencesTopics well explainedKeyworker and nurse very supportiveNothing negative to report

author: Landshark7
title: Changed my appointment twice within days of it being due
body:
I've had an MRI scan booked in for February since October last year. Two weeks ago they rearranged my appointment for a week later. Obviously not great, when you've booked time off work and have already been waiting a while. Then I've just received a letter today to cancel and rearrange my appointment, due in 4 days, for a second time, but this time not until the end of April now. So that's three days notice, without a reason and with no consideration for the four months I've already been waiting, and the further two I now have to sit tight for. I susoect it will probably get cancelled again.  
If it was the other way around and I kept cancelling they warn you on the very same letter they'd return you to your GP. Ha! Really not impressed at all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practic
body: Many thanks to all the staff for the excellent treatment I receive when I had a cataract removed, all the staff were friendly and put you at your ease.

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing staff
body:
This is my second visit to the haematology ward. I was originally in from March 2021 for three months down in the Ramone building. I have been in the new ward for just over two weeks. The staff are amazing and always listen to any queries I have and take into account my opinion on things.  
The nurses have great teamwork and communicate well with each other, they add a great atmosphere to the ward.  
I was diagnosed with leukaemia last year and the staff who diagnosed me were great, it must be very hard having to tell people such difficult news. Moreover, I feel extremely safe on this ward, I didn’t mind the lack of visiting throughout the pandemic as I was able to speak to my family on the phone and see them through the window. It was scary to be diagnosed with leukaemia and worrying about people bringing bugs in, so I felt very safe with the no visiting rule.  
I have previously attended the Macmillan outpatient clinic here in Craigavon and the staff there are brilliant and have been really supportive for both me and my family.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The level of care I am getting is so good
body:
Female medical has been really good. The level of care I am getting is so good.  
The cleanliness of the ward is outstanding and I feel like it is always at a top standard. The ward is a bit of craic so it is, I do not mind being here.  
The staff here are just something else. They do their best for everyone and work so hard. The hospital itself is well run but I think it is just short staffed.  
Female medical has been great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mcg142
title: The three staff are exemplary at their work and a credit to the Western Trust
body:
I attended Ohpcc today for my routine smear test in Contraception and sexual health dept in womens health.  
I just wanted to write a note of thanks for firstly Kathy for arranging appointment and the encouragement and friendly nature to go to such a daunting procedure. She is amazing at her job 💕  
When I went into the procedure I had another two amazing staff members: Dr Maguire and Sr Ashley. They were so encouraging, reassuring, friendly and professional. It is an amazing service offered by the WHSCT and the three staff are exemplary at their work and a credit to the Western Trust.  
Thank you again!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: cygnusrw36
title: It was the compassion that made the difference
body:
My Dad was admitted to Lagan Valley hospital in Lisburn in mid-February. On the Saturday evening he was moved to Ward 14.  
My experience of Ward 14 was beyond what I expected. Unfortunately my Dad was very poorly but the communication from the Dr's as to what was happening and the care shown to me by the nursing and auxiliary team is what really stands out.  
Medically everyone knew exactly what they were doing but it was the compassion that was shown at a time where we know the NHS is stretched to its limit that made the difference.  
One particular nurse, Priya, I will be eternally thankful to for making what was a very difficult time, that little bit easier. Thank you so much to Priya and all the team on Ward 14 at Lagan Valley Hospital in Lisburn.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I like that they try and talk to everyone
body:
Female medical is a great ward, the level of care they give us is something else.  
The food is great here, especially the variety we can have. The beds are really comfy which I am glad of since I am in it so much. I like that I am in a ward since I can talk to other people.  
The staff are so friendly. I think they are the best bunch of people and really are overworked. I like that they try and talk to everyone and make us feel normal.  
Female medical is a top class place.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ORB Admin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Helped to cut down on cannabis
body: Chloe is a lovely lady who has really helped me to cut down smoking cannabis, with helpful steps, giving advice and support on every step along the way.

author: DayDreamer455
title: A credit to the service
body:
I recently required an ultrasound at the X-ray department in Crosshouse hospital.  
I would like to express my thanks to the sonographer Kate and HCSW Morag for their amazing care. They were both so friendly and reassuring, explaining everything and ensuring I was ok.  
Both Kate and Morag are a credit to the service!

author: Daniellabelle
title: Caring ability for non verbal child
body: My son attended clinic 3 today for blood tests, which usually are an absolutely stressful experience. He is non verbal and has additional support needs. All of the staff today were absolutely incredible. They all displayed such a natural ability in caring for children and I couldn’t be any more thrilled with the care we received today. My son picked up on their skills and natures as well, meaning he coped amazingly well with the tests today and there wasn’t even a peep from him. Thank you so much and keep up the good work! You are all absolute angels.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They are really underestimated and are fantastic people.
body:
Male surgical has treated me well. The stress I had coming in has all disappeared since being here, everything has been good.  
The ward is really friendly and everyone speaks to each other which keeps me entertained.  
The staff are great here. They are really underestimated and are fantastic people. They treat me with respect and dignity.  
Male surgical has been a quiet ward thankfully.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ebony B
title: Amazing doctor for implant removal
body:
All the staff helped me with an appointment based around my daughter's childcare and all were really understanding.  
I then had a trainee called Dr Singh and she was simply amazing. She was gentle, caring and the perfect combination of professional and friendly.  
Out of the 3 times I’ve had my implant removed, that was the most comfortable I’ve felt.

author: outsmarted_by_rat_for_3_days
title: Thanks 111!
body:
I would like to thank the NHS 111 service in the Vale of Glamorgan and the minor injuries clinic at Barry Hospital for your very prompt and efficient service. Last month I was bitten by a rat that I was attempting to help escape my flat before my cat caught it. I wasn't sure what the protocol was for this, but it had bled quite a lot, so I called 111 and was immediately directed to a minor injuries unit 15 minutes away to receive a tetanus booster and antibiotics. I had never used 111 as an adult and had no idea what would happen or how long it would take, but the whole event from phone call to treatment was within 2 hours, for which I was very grateful, as I was going on a work trip the next day.  
(The rat continued to evade myself and 2 cats for a further 3 days, completely unscathed, after which I managed to humanely trap and release it).

readBy.name: Cardiff and Vale University Health Board

author: antliajc93
title: Having a CT Urogram.
body:
Experience in x ray depart was on the whole very good . The only real problem that I had was because I was having a urogram I had to drink 1 litre of water beforehand and was not allowed to go to toilet untill examination had finished which took approximately 30mins.  
Needless to say I was pretty desperate by that point but my examination was outside in CT van which had no toilet facilities, nearest toilets were in hospital reception or X-ray department which meant getting dressed. This made me very anxious and felt that perhaps patients who are having a CT that requires a full bladder could perhaps have their examination in main CT department which has easy access to toilets.

author: #old school nurse
title: Emergency visit to E.D.
body:
I attended ED in February 2023 with painful heel following a fall. I was directed to x-ray, where I was attended to by nurse practitioner and diagnosed with a queried achilles tendon injury and an appointment to return following day for ultra sound scan,which revealed Achilles tendon rupture and a DVT. I had plaster applied and anticoagulant given and appointment for next day at D.A.U. for investigations for D.V.T.  
I just wish to say from the minute I entered Antrim Area hospital I had exemplary care from all involved, such friendly and efficient caring staff, doctors, nurses, radiographers, pharmacists and ancillary staff... As a long retired nurse and realising what is involved in these very trying times for the N.H.S. I commend and praise all involved with special thanks to Nurse Practitioner Lindsay

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: corridorbs33
title: In safe hands
body: I was admitted on Thursday of this week to have surgery. I was extremely anxious / nervous and in an emotional state due to never having surgery before. The care I received was nothing short of amazing. The aneathatist did a fantastic job at reassuring me & calming me down. Dr Allen who was the surgeon that carried out my operation was unbelievable, I am extremely grateful for the excellent job he carried out giving me the best possible outcome I could have wished for. His knowledge & expertise is second to none, from explaining everything thoroughly and putting me at ease. I am forever thankful to have been in his safe hands, and to everyone else that cared for me.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ArthurG
title: Caring and sympathetic staff for colonoscopy
body:
I arrived at Paisley Royal Alexandra Hospital for a colonoscopy following a negative screening test. As you would expect I was feeling a bit anxious about the possible outcomes and a procedure that could be embarrassing.  
However right from the reception desk through to the theatre staff I was dealt with in a caring and sympathetic way that made the whole process straightforward and dignified.  
In particular I would like to mention two of the nursing staff, Caroline J and Sam R, whose care before and after the procedure was excellent and put me at ease right from the outset.

author: tigerws33
title: Amazing maternity services
body:
I recently gave birth in Altnagelvin hospital and received excellent care from all the staff in maternity services. A special word of thanks to Pauline and her student midwife Kirsty. Pauline respected all my wishes related to hypnobirthing and helped us create a lovely environment for the first hours of my labour. Pauline and Kirsty were lovely to talk to and my husband and I are still talking about how blissful those first hours were. They even came up to see us on the post natal ward to congratulate us as they had gone by the time I delivered. We’ll never forget yous!!  
Thanks also to midwife Mary. She was there for me when things became more difficult- she was great too and amazing in an emergency.  
I ended up needing a forcep delivery- at this stage I was exhausted and upset and I met so many people in theatre that I can’t remember by name but they all were amazing at a difficult time. I wish I knew the name of the male nurse who tried his best to keep me and my husband upbeat. He was lovely and left a lasting impression.  
I think the lady anaesthetist was called Catherine - she had a lovely personality and even made me smile. A very special thanks to Dr Nordon- she came to the rescue and as a result I had a straightforward forcep delivery and recovery has also be straightforward. I owe the life of my wee boy to her. She came up to the ante natal ward the following night to check on us which meant the world to me. She even offered advice from one mother to another.  
Thank you so much!! I wish I could name all the staff that night there were so many.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: moonqt93
title: Efficient Pre-Assessment
body: The nurse was accompanied by a 3rd year trainee and the latter carried out most of the assessment. I was made to feel very welcome, comfortable and relaxed. There was no waiting time and the whole process was efficient and completed in only 30 minutes, including ECG, blood pressure, chest sounding, blood samples and lots of questions.

author: charatp89
title: Made to feel uncomfortable
body:
My partner had an appointment for the Orthopedic department at the hospital and is obviously very keen to attend. However, we were driving to the appointment when literally half an hour before they cancelled on us.  
A second appointment was made but due to a traumatic and unexpected bereavement we unfortunately had to cancel this time to attend the funeral.  
A third appointment was made but unfortunately again a very close family member passed away and we have to cancel again.  
I am giving feedback for a number of reasons:  
• The staff member we spoke to showed no sympathy at all and actually mentioned that we had previously cancelled due to a bereavement  
• Made to feel guilty for cancelling.  
• Felt we were not treated well on the phone.  
Obviously my partner needs and want’s to attend the appointment but we both feel that we have been made to feel uncomfortable at a time when kindness and sympathy could have been shown an understanding of the difficult time my wife has had recently.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Quine
title: Booking an appointment at my GP practice
body:
Since COVID the local GP practice has taken on a different approach in operating the appointment service. As before you could make an appointment either for the day you called the GP practice or an appointment in advance. The new system allows you only to make an emergency appointment on the day you call the practice.  
The practice phone lines opens at 8:15 am, what is a very busy time of the day for many people who are either getting their children ready for school or commuters getting ready to go to work. Most of the time the line are engaged until about 8:45 am - 9 am and when your call is taken most of the appointments of the day are taken and you are requested to phone again the next day. If you are able to book an appointment you need to tell the receptionist the reason for your call, then the GP will phone you back during the day at any of his/her desired time. As a patient you are not allowed to request a time/time slot; after the phone call with the GP, the GP will make the decision if he/she want to see you in person. This whole process can take a couple of days, as sometimes the GP does not call back until after 4:00 pm and an appointment has to be made for the next or another day.  
The system is undermining peoples health condition because of the requirement that you are only allowed to make an emergency appointment. Instead of preventing a health or wellbeing issues of becoming more serious, they only allow you to make an appointment when the situation is getting out of control.

author: attendantpe46
title: Poor treatment
body:
I am unhappy about my experience in the injuries dept. I was brought to hospital by my fiancé as I am unable to walk or move in the car as it causes a lot of pain and discomfort to my ankle.  
The entrance to the Unit was locked, so I rang the bell and was told I had to enter through the main door, which seems strange to me as 2 minutes before me other patients had been admitted through the door to the unit. I was sent around the building with a sore leg. On calling 111 and then speaking to the gentleman from Kircaldy I was told I would have a short distance to walk from the car park. Unfortunately it was a much greater distance after I have been told to go to the main entrance.  
On arrival I had a discussion with a nurse and then an x-ray scan and returned to the same nurse. The nurse told me to get up and put weight on my leg, walk like I was healthy, even though I am obese so I should not put too much pressure on the ankle. I feel disgusted as I have a sprained ankle and the guidelines on the NHS website state not to put weight on the leg. I was not given any prescription, just a recommendation to take painkillers. All the patients I saw before me were walking out in leg stabilisers and I can unequivocally say that most of them were walking much better before entering the surgery, I was not given a stabiliser.  
I feel I have been treated very poorly and am disgusted with the approach to the patient.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: Phoenix22
title: We appreciate everything she did for us as a family.
body: Michele was my son’s health visitor for the first 6 months. Michele was always on hand to give advice whenever needed. She was quick to identify his flat head and the growth size, referrals were done to the different services. Would make contact after each different service to see how they went. Due to difficult circumstances, we had to move out of the area. Even during this time she still kept in contact to see if anything was needed. We appreciate everything she did for us as a family. Thank you

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent care of my husband and myself
body: My husband was admitted by ambulance to A&E with suspected pneumonia. An Xray and CT scan revealed extensive inflammation and historical damage to his lungs. He later suffered a heart attack and died. All the staff involved with his care on Midgley ward treated him with unwavering professionalism, but more importantly with kindness, gentleness and commitment to both his comfort and dignity. The doctors were willing to answer all my questions and kept me continually updated. They explained his condition clearly and honestly. They didn't patronise me. The staff were also mindful of my needs, making sure I had something to eat and drink. They allowed me to spend as much time as I needed to with my husband after he had died. They were also willing for me to help wash him before he was put in the body bag. One member of staff drove me home when her shift ended. I would like to thank everyone involved in my husband's treatment and care. I know that they did everything they could to keep him as safe, comfortable and pain-free as possible. They all exhibited a quality no amount of training can provide - compassion. Thank you all for your excellent care of us both.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great GP Appointment
body:
Really impressed with friendly staff, efficient service and response of GP, 
Great two way discussion to support diagnosis and agree treatment plan. I felt very at ease and encouraged to share my thoughts.

author: Annjr84
title: Opthalmology referal
body:
Due to cataract I was referred to QEUH in November 2022. To date I have not even had an acknowledgement of this referal. My cataract has rapidly worsened since November. I have been given 2 different telephone numbers to contact in regards to referal, both of which have came up as INVALID. These telephone numbers were given to me from member of staff at Opthalmology clininc. Trying to get an update and establish that I am on the system, is mission impossible.  
Now there may very well be a backlog but how does this excuse giving out invalid telephone numbers by staff? My eyesight is deteriorating rapidly because of the cataract and I have absolutely no clue what I'm supposed to do about this.  
Thanking you in advance for a proper telephone number in order that I can speak to someone about my situation.

title: Great Medical Care
body: The doctors at Elbury Moor could not have been more helpful providing a most caring and thorough treatment and assessment of my mothers medical needs after a recent fall. They were so supportive and helpful going that extra mile for her. Thank you

title: The best practice in New Malden
body: My Mother came to visit and unfortunately became unwell. I phoned the doctor and spoke to the Business Manager who registered my mother as a temporary patient. We completed a series of questions and she was booked promptly to see a GP on the same day. The GP we saw was so lovely, she examined my mum and treated her with kindness. All round excellent service received from Holmwood Corner. Thank you so much for the kindness you showed my mother.

author: JBut23
title: Great phlebotomy service
body: I had to get my blood taken for an upcoming surgery. I was sent to the phlebotomy clinic in lisburn by my pre op nurse. I got a phone call from a man who gave me my appointment and directions to the place and then also sent me a text message with details of appointment. He was friendly and helpful. The place was very easy to find and parking wasn’t an issue as many other places can be hard to find a parking space. Caroline was a lovely woman and made me feel very comfortable as I can be a nervous patient. Great service!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: geminijn99
title: I am so grateful to everyone that looked after us
body:
I attended daycare a few times to have my baby monitored as my baby wasn’t moving as much. My last visit was like a whirlwind. I phoned daycare as I checked my blood pressure at home and it was really high and spoke to Toni who looked after me at each visit. I didn’t want to attend as I felt I was just being paranoid but Toni persuaded me to attend to get checked over. When I arrived Toni started doing my blood pressure and put the heart trace on so she could monitor my baby which was all fine but Toni told me my blood pressure was up and needed to take blood.  
As I was talking to her she asked if I felt more swollen in my face as she could see a bit of difference from previous visits. I mentioned my parter said the same and I had pain in my right shoulder going through to my back which developed throughout the night and that morning. My blood pressure was really high and I had to get medication to try and lower it. Toni was calm and was talking to me and her student Isobel who was lovely (and will be a fantastic midwife when qualified) exactly what she was doing and why as she thought I was developing pre eclampsia.  
My blood pressure was not settling and remained high and I had to be admitted for closer monitoring and had to have stronger medication through a drip. The staff in labour ward were amazing also and I had to deliver my gorgeous boy I think it was about 4 hours after being admitted due to pre eclampsia. I just want to say thank you to toni especially for persuading me to attend and keeping me calm and explaining everything to me. I was told by the doctors if I stayed at home I could have become really unwell so thank you.  
4 weeks down the line my son and I are doing a lot better and I am so grateful to everyone that looked after us so well from day care, labour ward and ward 8. You are an amazing team and keep up the good work.

title: Excellent clinic
body:
My 8 yo grandson was bought in for day surgery ,floor 6 . Cannot fault the care and attention from all staff from he surgeon to the porter .
Felt we was looked after so well ,nothing to much.
All the staff explained yhe procedure well to us as well as my grandson.

author: pelicanrc99
title: Went in for a pre-op.
body: Had bloods taken weighed and height measured. I was asked about my medical history and my operation explained in detail. All the staff were excellent and very helpful.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Oustanding
body: Ward 21, professional, caring, empathetic, patient, knowledgeable and dedicated.  I’d never had surgery before, never stayed in hospital so I was anxious and fearful. From the moment I arrived, discussions with my surgeon to the quite frankly excellent aftercare, I realise I need not have worried.  My every need was met seamlessly.  I will be forever grateful for everything the hospital has done for me, and I’m hoping I will make a good recovery now I’m home.  Thank you.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Service
body: Three members of my family have needed to contact Brunswick surgery over the past few weeks and each time have been met with extremely efficient and helpful service. Prompt offers of appropriate same day reviews, including great flexibility in timing. Also used the out of hours service which was again very efficient, giving us an appropriate treatment and plan within an hour of calling up.

author: holly98
title: I am and will be forever grateful for all of the help.
body:
I recently finished CBT at IAPT Ealing with Sita. Since starting, my mood and self-esteem have improved significantly. Sita was very caring and kind, always asking if I felt comfortable and if I had eaten. She made me feel comfortable and able to talk openly. Sita was very considerate and would notice subtle changes in me during treatment and would notify me if she thought of anything else to help me, putting in a lot of effort to help me improve my mood.  
My daily life has improved a lot, and I now have a more positive view of life. I have also taken with me a lot of meaningful words from Sita, who has helped me view things from a new perspective. I am and will be forever grateful for all of the help. Thank you so much for everything :) !

title: Great Experience
body: I went to the Emmergency department to get treatment for an eye injury yesterday. I came in to contact with a number of staff members of this department during my visit. I found that the staff members are very kind, caring and highly professional.

title: Really good practice
body:
Having recently a health issue I had to have a few blood tests and then treatment twice a week for three weeks. The surgery staff were helpful in arranging short notice appointments and appointments were on time when I attended. 
The GP was really good at getting back to me when I had questions.

title: Lovely receptionist
body:
I have had to speak with reception a few times recently and the receptionist is very helpful and friendly. Calling the GP is stressful because it is about health which is worry and having such a calming, lovely lady on reception helps such a lot.
She also always goes the extra mile and does her best to help.

title: Excellent Support
body: As always my husband and I felt very supported by The Pinn Medical Centre. From the initial contact via the Patchs system through the call back and consultation, all was efficient yet caring. One could not ask for better.

title: Great practice
body:
Have had physiotherapy sessions over  six month period following
Replacement hip found the physiotherapy department thoroughly
Proffesional kind and sympathetic really helped in my road to recovery

title: Great practice
body:
Yesterday was my first visit to Whiteacres and I was blown away by the service I received ! The atmosphere is very calm and friendly and I was seen so quickly and efficiently. I felt that my needs had been met and that I had been treated as an individual and not as a number . 
Thank you so much

author: Wanda
title: Physio for pelvic floor
body: I was referred to physio because I was having difficulty going to the toilet due to a slight prolapse. I was seen by Debbie who really put me at ease. She gave me lots of strategies to manage the situation and worked with me to develop my pelvic floor over several months. She couldn’t have been kinder or more supportive. It was also a huge relief just to be able to talk to someone without the fear of embarrassment. The fact that I can also self refer back to the service in the future should I need to gives me great peace of mind.

author: JamieM123
title: Kind and helpful staff
body: I was seen post operation by the musculoskeletal service and the staff were very kind and helpful. I felt like I mattered and was not just a number.

readBy.name: Office of Ruth Maguire ( Mp for Cunninghame South )

title: Helpful and friendly
body:
Had a sudden and unexpected health scare.
I was incredibly scared and uncertain but the  morning receptionist that I spoke to was super helpful and friendly and put me at ease.
I can't tell you how much that meant.

title: Very helpful staff and dr
body:
I recently had to take my young daughter to the GP and from the first moment I spoke to the receptionist she couldn't have been more helpful and kind. Then when we met with the Dr he was incredibly helpful and his manner was perfect with seeing a young child. He was very thorough and spoke through all options with me.
As my daughter was not feeling better after a few days, when I called back again both the receptionist and Dr were incredibly helpful. 
The whole experience was very reassuring and I couldn't be happier with how we were spoken with and seen.

title: First class treatment
body: On 9 February I was admitted with a heart attack, I underwent an emergency procedure to have 2 stents fitted. The treatment I received was superb, I have nothing but praise for the doctors, nurses and all of the staff on ward b14. Please convey my sincere thanks to everyone.

title: Great friendly service
body: The staff are very friendly and informative.  This relates to the greeting at reception right through to the nurses, surgeon and support staff. They put you at ease and answer any concerns you may have.  The surgery was very quick, I am now reaping the benefits.  The Clinic is spacious and modern.

author: ORB South Admin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Enjoyed the group sessions
body:
Can we please have Art Box on again. Not been on for two weeks now  
I have enjoyed my Inspire Group sessions  
Help me break up my pattern of addiction

title: Fantastic service
body: We are a family of four who have been patients at this practice for 17 years. Throughout that time we have been consistently impressed by the quality of service provided by admin staff, nurses and GPs. We particularly appreciate the ease with which we have been able to get medical attention when needed and the speed of response. Without exception the medical professionals we have dealt with have been polite, friendly and reassuring. Between us we have been to see them for cancer scares, blood tests, asthma check ups and many other routine medical problems. We also like the triage system which enables us to see a nurse who can refer up to a GP if needed, this is particularly good if we know what the problem is and just need a prescription. All in all we would highly recommend this GP practice and want them to know how much we appreciate their hard work under challenging circumstances, especially over the last three years.

title: Excellent practice
body: All Doctors and staff are very helpful and our family are very fortunate to have such a great practice in our area.

title: Great practice
body: My asthma nurse gave me a thorough review and was very knowledgeable.  She was friendly and professional and demonstrated a powder preventer for me to use.

author: LyKv2023
title: Safe delivery of my 3rd baby
body:
I want to express my sincere gratitude to the Southern Trust maternity team who delivered my third daughter in February 2023 in Daisy Hill Hospital. After a previous traumatic delivery, I was very anxious about the safe progression and delivery of this baby. From my first appointment Dr Finnegan and the South Tyrone midwives observed and reassured me from day one and planned my section as soon as feasible giving me great ease of mind.  
To Dr Boggs and his theatre team on the day who safely delivered her in the most professional and safe manner, quickly and efficiently, keeping me calm throughout. To the post natal midwives in Daisy Hill ward 5A, who were an excellent support and you could express any concerns or worries to with ease, and to the community midwives from South Tyrone hospital who supported me at home, and whose warmth and professionalism were second to none.  
I thank you all individually for making this episode of care the best it could have been for me, and appreciate deeply your knowledge and guidance throughout. Thank you all so much!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant
body: I have had a faultless service from the staff and doctors in fact i believe they went beyond what was expected. Many thanks

title: Great practice
body: This surgery have always been amazing. My youngest child is unfortunately regularly poorly, and they have always gone above and beyond to see him or ensure he gets the medical attention required. The doctors are caring and understanding, proactive and truly listen. The nurses and receptionist are also equally as fantastic. Thank you for all of your continued hard work and excellent service.

title: Efficient and helpful
body: Used the Ask my GP website and the practitioner got back to me on the same day. Explained the issues and she gave me great info and recommendations relating to menopause.  Friendly and helpful. Very happy being with the surgery as I know others have different experiences on getting help for menopause symptoms. Thanks!

author: Jon2345
title: Ward3A Ulster Hospital
body:
My relative was brought in by ambulance and had two weeks of excellent care and attention from everyone. Their family would like to thank everyone involved, regrettably they were not strong enough to survive but that was only after every possible effort had been made. They were made as comfortable as possible and those of the family who were able to visit were also looked after by the staff.  
It was a tough experience but greatly eased by the care and consideration of an exceptional body of staff.  
Thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tungsten23
title: My Grandad passing away
body:
I lost my Grandad in January to an unexpected illness and he was receiving end of care treatment for a lung disease, I was assisting and helping my grandad and grandma to prepare food and medication for him and make sure I gave all the help I could until I lost him.  
This situation made me feel many different ways; it made me feel low and it made me feel in constant pain and numbness. I didn't expect to feel as hurt and distraught, losing such a role model is the last thing you want and need in life at such a young age but I reached out to get the care I needed for my mental health and the support so far has been exceptional and I couldn't be more grateful and appreciative.

author: mrsmotivated
title: Respiratory Physio Classes & made new friends
body:
I was invited to do Respiratory Physio Classes on zoom for a period of 6 weeks twice a week. I have COPD and Asthma but I am not house bound and not considered severe however I struggle walking up inclines. I can walk a long way on the flat. After initial few meetings I wondered if this was worth continuing but I stuck with it and found it very helpful.  
I found out things I did not know about the need for upper body strength and exercise and that just doing some basic exercises, and even adding in weights, helped and were not all as easy as I had expected they would be.  
The group also jelled well and some of us decided to stay in touch via WhatsApp to support each other or do the odd physio session online on our own just for encouragement to keep it going! We all felt also by half way through that we felt comfortable asking the nurses questions about our own condition and how we felt that day or week. It was encouraging to hear others, not only the nurses, sympathising and encouraging each other.I am also pleased that they do a referral to the local gym and exercise classes where I can now get a discount for a period of time to join and a bespoke training system if I attend as the health details that are relevant are passed on to the local exercise centre so they can advise on the best exercises for me.Would recommend doing this class even if some of the talks given are not relevant to you, eg for me that was smoking advice.The only thing that could be improved is if they did a follow up in 6 month time.

author: Chereid
title: Telephone waiting times to book an appointment
body: I have been waiting on 2 separate calls today for 1.5 hours to speak to someone in an appointment office with no answer. I feel exhausted, frustrated and unheard. I can’t re-book an appointment that has been cancelled by Musgrave Park orthopaedics at short notice.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sefkmum
title: Mum’s hospital admission
body:
Mum was admitted to ARU4 at the Queen Elizabeth hospital in Glasgow after calling an ambulance on Wednesday having suffered symptoms of a TIA.  
The ambulance came very quickly and she was assessed by two very competent and kind technicians, Megan & Joe, who agreed that a visit to hospital was required. We had a bit of a wait on arrival at the hospital, but they kept an eye on mum and made us aware of what was happening.  
Mum was eventually moved to an assessment area as she was next in the queue and I had to leave her there and go to the waiting room. I was told I would be allowed to rejoin her as soon as she was in a cubicle, but unfortunately this didn’t happen and we were separated for several hours which given her age(late eighties) and very poor hearing was stressful for us both.  
Having said that, mum was well looked after and had blood tests and a scan and when she asked the doctor about where I was he came to the waiting area and called me through.  
By this time we were told that it did seem to be a TIA and while the scan looked pretty good she would be kept in for observation at least overnight. Our only other concern at this point was that mum had nothing to eat or drink apart from a few sips of coffee.  
After another wait we were moved to the ward, but unfortunately a room wasn’t ready so we had a wait in the corridor where a lovely member of staff who had been cleaning in the area offered and brought us tea/coffee and biscuits which were very much appreciated.  
Once we got into the room a nurse came and completed paperwork on mum’s abilities/existing conditions and I left her eating her dinner.  
Overnight mum had observations done and was relatively comfortable.  
During her stay she was amazed and impressed by the treatment she received by every member of staff she encountered, everyone was friendly and took time to talk to her despite her hearing difficulties. She also said the food was excellent compared to what she had experienced in previous hospital stays.  
As a family, our only issue was lack of information as we couldn’t get through to the ward for an update and nobody called with any information. Mum is unable to use a mobile phone but did manage to communicate through her tablet which we had linked to hospital WiFi. She believed someone had called us with an update.  
All in all we would like to thank everyone for looking after mum so well and particular thanks to staff nurse Nicola who explained everything to us on discharge, re-attached her tablet to the WiFi, listened to her life story (at least once) and chatted to her about the football. Also to a doctor (whose name I’ve forgotten) who was able to update me on what was going on during a visit.

author: hearthammer 1
title: Rehabilitation care package
body:
I was referred to the cardiology team at HH due to breathing issues when walking and exercising, I attended various assessment clinics until I was referred to Dr Carrick, who carried out a heart catheterisation procedure and I was told that due to the severe flattening of my arteries, a stent procedure could not be done. Dr Carrick and the team met and agreed that I should be referred to the Golden Jubilee National Hospital for a double by pass (CABG). I have to say that everyone at HH did everything that they could do to make sure that I was cared for and I was provided with the very highest standards of medical treatment, care and advice. I was handed over to the care of the incredible health professionals at The Golden Jubilee National Hospital. My CABG was carried out by Professor Al Attar  
I cannot speak highly enough about the preparation, care, advice and empathy and complete professionalism delivered by everyone at The Golden Jubilee National Hospital.  
Its now eighteen weeks post operation and my recovery is excellent and that is down to the incredible and very thorough after care provided by The Golden Jubilee and the Cardiology health care professionals at Hairmyres Hospital.  
I have just completed four weekly sessions of Cardiology Physio Rehabilitation at HH and I can say that I am thankful to everyone involved in my rehabilitation care package.  
I would recommend attending the physio rehabilitation sessions.

author: Baron_rob
title: A professional experience
body:
Bright, industrious, super listener. I came in for pre immunotherapy treatment meeting. Nicol was courteous and got down to the job in a professional manner. Cleared through the questions efficiently. Took my bloods. In addition she went out of my way to see if I could get some antibiotics for my chest, came back for me to provide a sputum sample. This was sent off for testing.  
All in all a professional experience.  
Thanks Nicol.

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I cannot thank the team enough
body: I can't thank the team enough for everything they have done for me. My daughter is also very pleased and thankful for everything the team has done for me.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: LastPrinlawsBoy
title: My cardiac aftercare
body:
On discovery that I had prostate cancer I had to have various tests done. During these, I was diagnosed with a heart problem. Once my blood pressure and heartbeat was stabilised, I was given entry to a Cardiac Rehab course. The three women that gave me the instructions on how I was to proceed could not have been more understanding and helpful.  
They assisted me, encouraged me and then recommended that I try a further Rehab course operated by a team of cancer/heart trained personnel from the Michael Woods Gym in Glenrothes. I will be attending this with a view to restarting visiting the gym under my own steam. I would like to show my complete gratitude to the young ladies by doing the best I can at the gym.

author: telescopiummr53
title: My Grandmother
body:
My grandmother was admitted to Kilbryde Hospice in East Kilbride after a progressive illness. It was a difficult decision to take her out of her home and move her to the hospice but a decision we made together and we have no regrets.  
We were both welcomed with smiles and support and my gran settled in well. All the staff at the hospice are wonderful and accommodating. Dealing with my grans illness has been tough for both my gran and I and the care level for both families and patients is second to none. They are fabulous.

author: andromedagf49
title: AAU waiting time
body:
We arrived at AAU at 1:30. It is now after 6:00. My wife was referred by the GP who had a concern about a stroke. She has finally gone for a CT scan. We have been stuck in a waiting room till now. It has an infuriating beeper that I assume to be an unanswered telephone.  
A nice lady who volunteers made us a cup of tea but it appears that there are no free beds if my wife needed to be admitted. Some people have been here longer than us. This is a terrible waste of peoples time. We feel tired, bored and undervalued.

author: silverwarexz73
title: Frustrating delay
body:
I arrived 10 minutes early for a 10:40 appointment. I saw the doctor soon after 12 noon so my appointment was almost 1 1/2 hours late. For my last appointment I was held up and arrived 10 minutes late for the first time ever only to find the staff waiting for me so I was only in the hospital for 10-15 minutes. I just do not understand the difference, maybe form filling between patients?  
Whatever the reason it needs sorting out, I was going to walk out and perhaps if enough of us did management might get their act together and deal with this situation. I am not blaming the staff for the delays, the procedure they have to follow is more likely the problem.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: pilingsck58
title: Removal of kidney stone
body:
I was in Queen Margaret day hospital in February. This was my first time going under anaesthetic so I was a bit nervous - in my sixties and the first time.  
My stay there was outstanding, especially the anaesthetists who really put me at my ease. The nurses and everyone involved were great. I wish I could thank them all

author: statuspb38
title: Care and support for us and our son!
body:
Over the years we have never needed support for our son but 2 years ago his mental health declined and we needed some help. The ICATT North team have been brilliant throughout and have always been very helpful and approachable and are always available to talk to us when we need some support.  
We don't know what we would have done without them over the last two years - they have been an excellent service and have always been here for all three of us.  
We feel that ICATT listened to us and understood how we were feeling at a very stressful time and feel they all not only care about our son but his family too.
